information: The common cold is a viral infection of the upper respiratory tract.
recommendation: Rest, drink plenty of fluids, and consider using saline nasal sprays to relieve congestion.
medicine: Over-the-counter medications such as decongestants and pain relievers can help alleviate symptoms.
symptoms: Runny or stuffy nose, sore throat, cough, congestion, slight body aches, sneezing, low-grade fever

information: Influenza, commonly known as the flu, is a contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses that infect the nose, throat, and sometimes the lungs.
recommendation: Get plenty of rest, drink fluids, and consider over-the-counter medications for symptom relief. It's also advisable to stay home from work or school to prevent spreading the virus to others.
medicine: Antiviral medications like oseltamivir (Tamiflu) or zanamivir (Relenza) can be prescribed by a healthcare provider to reduce the severity and duration of symptoms if taken early.
symptoms: Fever, chills, cough, sore throat, runny or stuffy nose, muscle or body aches, fatigue, headaches.

information: Strep throat is a bacterial infection caused by Group A Streptococcus bacteria. It affects the throat and tonsils and is highly contagious.
recommendation: Rest, drink plenty of fluids, and take over-the-counter pain relievers like acetaminophen or ibuprofen to alleviate symptoms. It's crucial to complete the full course of antibiotics as prescribed by a healthcare provider.
medicine: Antibiotics such as penicillin or amoxicillin are commonly prescribed to treat strep throat and prevent complications.
symptoms: Sudden and severe sore throat, pain when swallowing, fever, swollen tonsils, red spots on the roof of the mouth, and swollen lymph nodes in the neck.

information: COVID-19 is a respiratory illness caused by the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2, first identified in Wuhan, China, in late 2019.
recommendation: Follow public health guidelines, including wearing masks, practicing physical distancing, washing hands frequently, and getting vaccinated when eligible. Seek medical attention if you have severe symptoms such as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain, confusion, or bluish lips or face.
medicine: There are currently no specific antiviral medications approved to treat COVID-19, but supportive care and medications to alleviate symptoms are used depending on the severity of the illness
symptoms: Common symptoms include fever, cough, shortness of breath, fatigue, body aches, loss of taste or smell, sore throat, congestion, nausea or vomiting, and diarrhea

information: Gastroenteritis, commonly known as stomach flu, is inflammation of the stomach and intestines caused by viral or bacterial infections, or sometimes parasites.
recommendation: Drink plenty of fluids to prevent dehydration, and consider oral rehydration solutions to replace lost electrolytes. Eat bland foods like crackers, rice, bananas, and toast. Rest and avoid dairy products, caffeine, alcohol, and spicy foods until symptoms improve
medicine: Treatment focuses on symptom relief with over-the-counter medications for cough and fever, and in some cases, bronchodilators or steroids to reduce inflammation
symptoms: Symptoms include diarrhea, vomiting, abdominal cramps, nausea, fever, and sometimes headache or body aches.

information: Bronchitis is an inflammation of the bronchial tubes (airways) in the lungs, typically caused by viral infections (acute bronchitis) or prolonged exposure to irritants (chronic bronchitis).
recommendation: Rest, drink fluids, use a humidifier, and avoid irritants such as smoke or pollutants. Seek medical attention if symptoms worsen or if you have a high fever or difficulty breathing.
medicine: Rest, stay hydrated, take prescribed medications as directed, and follow up with a healthcare provider for monitoring and recovery.
symptoms: Common symptoms include cough (with or without mucus), chest discomfort, fatigue, mild fever, and shortness of breath.

information: Pneumonia is an infection that inflames air sacs in one or both lungs, which may fill with fluid or pus, causing cough with phlegm or pus, fever, chills, and difficulty breathing.
recommendation: Rest, stay hydrated, take prescribed medications as directed, and follow up with a healthcare provider for monitoring and recovery.
medicine: Treatment typically involves antibiotics for bacterial pneumonia, antiviral medications for viral pneumonia, and supportive care to relieve symptoms such as fever and pain.
symptoms: Symptoms vary but often include cough, fever, chills, chest pain, rapid breathing, and fatigue.

information: Asthma is a chronic lung disease characterized by inflammation and narrowing of the airways, leading to recurrent episodes of wheezing, coughing, chest tightness, and shortness of breath.
recommendation: Use asthma action plans, avoid triggers like allergens and smoke, maintain a healthy lifestyle, and regularly monitor lung function.
medicine: Treatment involves long-term control medications (such as inhaled corticosteroids) to reduce inflammation and rescue medications (such as bronchodilators) to relieve acute symptoms.
symptoms: Symptoms include wheezing, coughing (especially at night or early morning), shortness of breath, and chest tightness.

information: Allergies are an immune system response to substances (allergens) that are usually harmless, causing symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose, itchy eyes, and skin rashes.
recommendation: Identify and avoid triggers, use medications as directed, keep indoor air clean, and consult with an allergist for personalized management.
medicine: Treatment includes avoiding allergens, using over-the-counter or prescription antihistamines, nasal corticosteroids, and allergy shots (immunotherapy) for severe allergies.
symptoms: Symptoms vary depending on the allergen but commonly include sneezing, runny or stuffy nose, itchy eyes or skin, and swelling or hives.

information: Diabetes is a chronic condition where the body either does not produce enough insulin (Type 1 diabetes) or cannot effectively use insulin (Type 2 diabetes), leading to high blood sugar levels.
recommendation: Follow a diabetes management plan, monitor blood sugar levels regularly, maintain a healthy diet and weight, exercise regularly, and seek medical care for personalized guidance.
medicine: Treatment includes insulin therapy (for Type 1 diabetes), oral medications or insulin injections (for Type 2 diabetes), blood sugar monitoring, healthy eating, and regular exercise.
symptoms: Symptoms include increased thirst, frequent urination, extreme hunger, unexplained weight loss, fatigue, blurred vision, and slow healing of wounds.

information: Hypertension is a condition where the force of blood against the artery walls is consistently too high. It can lead to serious health problems over time.
recommendation: Maintaining a healthy lifestyle with balanced diet, regular exercise, and stress management is crucial. Regular monitoring of blood pressure is recommended.
medicine: Common medications include ACE inhibitors, beta-blockers, and diuretics. Consult a healthcare provider for appropriate treatment.
symptoms: Often asymptomatic, but severe cases may cause headaches, shortness of breath, or nosebleeds.

information: Anemia occurs when there's a deficiency of red blood cells or hemoglobin in the blood, reducing its ability to carry oxygen to tissues
recommendation: Consuming iron-rich foods like leafy greens, meats, and fortified cereals can help manage mild cases. Severe anemia requires medical attention for proper diagnosis and treatment.
medicine: Iron supplements are commonly prescribed for iron-deficiency anemia. Vitamin B12 or folic acid supplements may be necessary for other types
symptoms: Common symptoms include fatigue, weakness, pale skin, and shortness of breath.

information: A UTI is an infection in any part of the urinary system, including the kidneys, bladder, or urethra, typically caused by bacteria
recommendation: Drinking plenty of water, urinating frequently, and practicing good hygiene are preventive measures. Prompt treatment with antibiotics is necessary to prevent complications.
medicine: Antibiotics such as nitrofurantoin or trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole are commonly prescribed. Pain relievers may also be used for symptomatic relief.
symptoms: Symptoms often include a strong, persistent urge to urinate, burning sensation during urination, cloudy or bloody urine, and pelvic pain in women

information: A migraine is a neurological condition characterized by intense headaches often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light and sound
recommendation: Managing triggers like stress, certain foods, and irregular sleep patterns can help prevent migraines. Treatment options include medications to relieve symptoms and lifestyle adjustments.
medicine: Medications for acute migraines include triptans and NSAIDs. Preventive medications such as beta-blockers or antidepressants may be prescribed for frequent migraines.
symptoms: Symptoms can include throbbing pain on one side of the head, visual disturbances (aura), and heightened sensitivity to stimuli.

information: Depression is a mood disorder that causes persistent feelings of sadness and loss of interest in daily activities. It can affect how you feel, think, and handle daily activities.
recommendation: Treatment may include therapy, medication, or a combination of both. Lifestyle changes such as regular exercise and a healthy diet can also be beneficial.
medicine: Antidepressants like SSRIs or SNRIs are commonly prescribed. It's important to consult a healthcare provider for proper diagnosis and treatment.
symptoms: Symptoms include feelings of sadness, hopelessness, loss of interest in activities once enjoyed, changes in appetite or weight, and trouble sleeping or sleeping too much.

information: Anxiety disorders involve excessive worry or fear that significantly impacts daily life. They are among the most common mental health disorders
recommendation: Treatment options include therapy (such as cognitive-behavioral therapy) and medications (like SSRIs or benzodiazepines). Lifestyle changes and stress management techniques are also beneficial.
medicine: Medications like antidepressants or anti-anxiety drugs may be prescribed based on the type and severity of anxiety disorder.
symptoms: Symptoms can include excessive worrying, restlessness, fatigue, difficulty concentrating, and physical symptoms such as increased heart rate or sweating.

information: Chickenpox is a highly contagious viral infection caused by the varicella-zoster virus. It causes an itchy rash with red spots and fluid-filled blisters
recommendation: Vaccination (varicella vaccine) is the best way to prevent chickenpox. Treatment focuses on relieving symptoms with antiviral medications and over-the-counter remedies for itching.
medicine: Antiviral drugs like acyclovir may be prescribed, especially for high-risk individuals or severe cases.
symptoms: Symptoms include an itchy rash that usually starts on the face and chest, fever, and fatigue

information: Measles is a highly contagious viral infection that spreads through respiratory droplets. It causes a red, blotchy rash and other flu-like symptoms
recommendation: Vaccination (MMR vaccine) is highly effective in preventing measles. Treatment focuses on managing symptoms and preventing complications.
medicine: There is no specific antiviral treatment for measles. Supportive care includes rest, fluids, and over-the-counter medications for fever and discomfort.
symptoms: Symptoms include a high fever, cough, runny nose, red eyes, and a rash that starts on the face and spreads downward.

information: Mononucleosis, often called mono, is a viral infection caused by the Epstein-Barr virus. It's commonly transmitted through saliva and is sometimes called the "kissing disease."
recommendation: Rest, hydration, and over-the-counter pain relievers are recommended. Avoiding close contact, especially kissing, can help prevent spreading the virus.
medicine: There is no specific antiviral treatment for mono. Treatment focuses on managing symptoms like fever, sore throat, and swollen lymph nodes.
symptoms: Symptoms include extreme fatigue, sore throat, fever, swollen lymph nodes in the neck and armpits, and sometimes a rash.

information: Tonsillitis is inflammation of the tonsils, typically caused by viral or bacterial infections. It can cause sore throat, difficulty swallowing, and fever.
recommendation: Rest, fluids, and over-the-counter pain relievers like acetaminophen or ibuprofen can help manage symptoms. Antibiotics may be prescribed for bacterial tonsillitis.
medicine: Antibiotics such as penicillin or amoxicillin are prescribed for bacterial tonsillitis. Antiviral medications are used for viral tonsillitis if necessary.
symptoms: Symptoms include sore throat, swollen tonsils, difficulty swallowing, and sometimes white or yellow patches on the tonsils.

information: Inflammation or swelling of the tissue lining the sinuses.
recommendation: Use nasal decongestants and maintain hydration.

information: Inflammation of the appendix, which can cause severe abdominal pain.
recommendation: Seek immediate medical attention; surgery may be needed.
symptoms: Lower right abdominal pain, fever, nausea

information: A chronic inflammatory lung disease causing obstructed airflow from the lungs.
recommendation: Quit smoking, use inhalers, and pulmonary rehabilitation.
symptoms: Shortness of breath, wheezing, chronic cough

information: Refers to various heart conditions, including coronary artery disease and heart attacks.
recommendation: Adopt a heart-healthy diet, exercise, and medication.
symptoms: Chest pain, shortness of breath, fatigue

information: Occurs when blood flow to an area of the brain is interrupted or reduced.
Inflammation of one or more joints, causing pain and stiffness.
recommendation: Use anti-inflammatory medications and physical therapy.
symptoms: Joint pain, swelling, reduced range of motion

information: A condition that makes the skin red and itchy.
A skin disease that causes red, itchy scaly patches.
symptoms: Red patches of skin covered with thick, silvery scales

information: A condition in which the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormone.
A condition in which the thyroid gland produces too much thyroid hormone.
recommendation: Use antithyroid medications or radioactive iodine.

information: A serious infectious disease that mainly affects the lungs.
symptoms: Persistent cough, chest pain, coughing up blood

information: A highly contagious liver infection caused by the hepatitis A virus.
A serious liver infection caused by the hepatitis B virus.
A liver infection caused by the hepatitis C virus.
recommendation: Antiviral medications to clear the virus from the body.

information: An autoimmune disorder where ingestion of gluten leads to damage in the small intestine.
A type of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) that can affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract.
recommendation: Anti-inflammatory medications and surgery if necessary.

information: A common disorder affecting the large intestine.
recommendation: Dietary changes, stress management, and medication.

information: A disease in which the immune system eats away at the protective covering of nerves.
A progressive nervous system disorder that affects movement.
recommendation: Medication to manage symptoms, physical therapy.

information: A progressive disease that destroys memory and other important mental functions.
symptoms: Memory loss, confusion, difficulty with language

information: A chronic brain disorder that affects a person's ability to think, feel, and behave clearly.
A mental health condition causing extreme mood swings including emotional highs and lows.
A disorder characterized by unwanted, recurring thoughts and behaviors.
A mental health condition triggered by a terrifying event.
An infectious disease caused by the Borrelia bacterium, spread by ticks.
A common sexually transmitted infection caused by bacteria.
A sexually transmitted bacterial infection that, if untreated, may cause infertility.
A sexually transmitted infection caused by the bacterium Treponema pallidum.
symptoms: Sores, rash, fever, swollen lymph nodes

information: A virus that attacks the body's immune system, potentially leading to AIDS.
A viral infection that can cause warts and is linked to various cancers.
Inflammation of the protective membranes covering the brain and spinal cord.
Inflammation of the brain, often due to infection.
An autoimmune disease where the body's immune system attacks its own tissues.
An autoimmune disorder causing inflammation and deformity of the joints.
A condition where bones become weak and brittle.
recommendation: Calcium and vitamin D supplements, and medication.
symptoms: Fractures, loss of height, back pain

information: A form of arthritis characterized by severe pain, redness, and tenderness in joints.
Low blood sugar levels, which can cause various symptoms and complications.
High blood sugar levels, often associated with diabetes.
recommendation: Insulin therapy and blood sugar management.

information: High levels of cholesterol in the blood, increasing the risk of heart disease.
symptoms: No specific symptoms, detected through blood tests

information: A genetic disorder affecting the lungs and digestive system.
symptoms: Persistent cough, frequent lung infections, poor growth

information: A genetic disorder causing red blood cells to assume a sickle shape, leading to blockages and pain.
symptoms: Pain episodes, fatigue, swelling in hands and feet

information: A progressive brain disorder caused by a defective gene.
recommendation: Medications to manage symptoms, supportive care.
symptoms: Involuntary movements, cognitive decline, mood swings

information: A progressive nervous system disease that affects nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord.
recommendation: Supportive care and medications to slow disease progression.
symptoms: Muscle weakness, difficulty speaking and swallowing

information: A neurological disorder marked by sudden recurrent episodes of sensory disturbance or convulsions.
Inflammation of the pancreas that can be acute or chronic.
Sores that develop on the lining of the stomach, small intestine, or esophagus.
recommendation: Antibiotics for H. pylori infection, acid reducers.

information: Hardened deposits within the fluid in the gallbladder.
symptoms: Sudden intense pain in the upper right abdomen, nausea

information: Inflammation or infection of small pouches that can form in the intestines.
recommendation: Antibiotics and a liquid diet initially.

information: Swollen veins in the lowest part of the rectum and anus.
recommendation: Dietary changes, topical treatments, and procedures.

information: Hard deposits made of minerals and salts that form inside the kidneys.
recommendation: Pain relief and hydration; in severe cases, surgery.

information: A long-term condition where the kidneys do not work effectively.
A sudden episode of kidney failure or damage.
recommendation: Treating the underlying cause and supportive care.
medicine: Fluids, medications to balance blood levels

information: A liver disease caused by the hepatitis E virus.
recommendation: Supportive care and maintaining good hygiene.

information: Severe scarring of the liver caused by long-term liver damage.
A mosquito-borne infectious disease caused by Plasmodium parasites.
A mosquito-borne viral infection causing flu-like symptoms.
symptoms: High fever, severe headache, joint and muscle pain

information: A mosquito-borne virus that can cause birth defects.
A viral disease transmitted by mosquitoes causing joint pain.
A virus spread by mosquitoes, often asymptomatic but can cause neurological disease.
symptoms: Fever, headache, body aches, joint pains

information: A rare and deadly viral disease causing severe bleeding and organ failure.
symptoms: Fever, severe headache, muscle pain, bleeding

information: A virus spread by rodents causing severe respiratory issues.
symptoms: Fever, muscle aches, cough, shortness of breath

information: A viral disease transmitted by mosquitoes causing fever and jaundice.
A bacterial infection causing high fever and gastrointestinal issues.
recommendation: Antibiotic treatment and maintaining good hygiene.
symptoms: High fever, stomach pain, headache, loss of appetite

information: A bacterial disease spread through the urine of infected animals.
A serious bacterial infection causing muscle stiffness and spasms.
symptoms: Jaw cramping, muscle stiffness, difficulty swallowing

information: A viral disease causing inflammation of the brain, typically fatal once symptoms appear.
symptoms: Fever, headache, excess salivation, muscle spasms

information: A serious infection caused by Bacillus anthracis bacteria, can be contracted through skin, inhalation, or ingestion.
symptoms: Skin sores, fever, chills, chest discomfort

information: Bacterial infection transmitted by fleas.
Infection causing severe diarrhea and dehydration.
Chronic bacterial disease affecting skin and nerves.
symptoms: Skin lesions, nerve damage, muscle weakness

information: Parasitic infection from contaminated soil.
Fungal infection of the skin, hair, or nails.
Skin infestation by mites causing intense itching.
Viral infection causing itchy skin rashes and blisters.
Highly contagious viral infection with a characteristic rash.
Viral infection with a mild rash and fever.
symptoms: Mild fever, rash, swollen lymph nodes

information: Viral infection affecting the salivary glands.
Inflammation of the tonsils, often due to viral or bacterial infection.
recommendation: Rest, fluids, and possible antibiotic treatment.

information: Inflammation of the sinuses, often caused by infection.
Middle ear infection, common in children.
Inflammation or infection of the outer membrane of the eyeball and the inner eyelid.
Red, painful lump near the edge of the eyelid.
recommendation: Warm compresses and possible antibiotic ointment.
symptoms: Painful lump on the eyelid, swelling

information: Inflammation of the eyelid margins.
recommendation: Good eyelid hygiene and possibly antibiotic ointment.

information: Inflammation of the cornea, often due to infection.
recommendation: Antibacterial, antifungal, or antiviral eye drops.
symptoms: Eye pain, blurred vision, sensitivity to light

information: Inflammation of the bladder, often due to infection.
recommendation: Increased fluid intake and possibly antibiotics.
symptoms: Painful urination, frequent urge to urinate

information: Inflammation of the prostate gland, often due to infection.
symptoms: Pelvic pain, urinary issues, flu-like symptoms

information: Growth of endometrial tissue outside the uterus.
recommendation: Pain relief, hormone therapy, or surgery.

information: Hormonal disorder causing enlarged ovaries with cysts.
symptoms: Irregular periods, excess hair growth, acne

information: The end of menstrual cycles, typically occurring in midlife.
recommendation: Hormone replacement therapy (HRT) and lifestyle changes.
symptoms: Hot flashes, night sweats, mood changes

information: Infection of the female reproductive organs.
symptoms: Pelvic pain, fever, abnormal vaginal discharge

information: Noncancerous growths in the uterus.
symptoms: Heavy menstrual bleeding, pelvic pain, frequent urination

information: Infection of the inner lining of the heart chambers and valves.
Inflammation of the pericardium, the sac surrounding the heart.
Inflammation of the heart muscle, often due to viral infection.
recommendation: Rest and medication to manage symptoms.
symptoms: Chest pain, shortness of breath, fatigue

information: Damage or defect in one of the four heart valves.
recommendation: Medication or surgery depending on severity.
symptoms: Shortness of breath, fatigue, swollen ankles

information: Bulge in the wall of the aorta that can burst if untreated.
recommendation: Monitoring or surgery depending on size.
symptoms: Back pain, deep pain on the side of the abdomen, pulsating sensation near the navel

information: Thickening of the heart muscle, often inherited.
Irregular heartbeat that can be too fast, too slow, or erratic.
recommendation: Medication, lifestyle changes, or procedures like pacemaker implantation.

information: Chronic autoimmune neuromuscular disorder causing weakness in skeletal muscles.
symptoms: Muscle weakness, drooping eyelids, difficulty swallowing

information: Rare autoimmune disorder where the immune system attacks the nerves.
symptoms: Weakness, tingling in extremities, difficulty breathing

information: Autoimmune disease affecting multiple organs and tissues.
recommendation: Medication to reduce symptoms and prevent flare-ups.

information: Autoimmune disorder affecting the glands that produce moisture.
recommendation: Medication and eye drops to manage symptoms.
symptoms: Dry eyes, dry mouth, joint pain

information: Inflammation of blood vessels, causing changes in vessel walls.
recommendation: Medication to control inflammation and immune response.
symptoms: Fever, fatigue, weight loss, muscle and joint pain

information: Chronic arthritis associated with psoriasis.
recommendation: Medication to reduce inflammation and pain.
symptoms: Joint pain, stiffness, swelling, skin rash

information: Rare disorder causing blood vessel inflammation throughout the body.
recommendation: Medication to manage symptoms and inflammation.
symptoms: Mouth sores, eye inflammation, skin rashes

information: Inflammatory disease marked by muscle weakness and skin rash.
symptoms: Muscle weakness, skin rash, difficulty swallowing

information: Inflammatory disease causing muscle weakness.
Inflammation of the bursae (small sacs of fluid near joints).
Form of arthritis characterized by sudden, severe attacks of pain, redness, and tenderness in joints.
Chronic disorder that can result in enlarged and misshapen bones.
Long-term condition causing extreme tiredness.
symptoms: Severe fatigue, muscle pain, sleep disturbances

information: Chronic condition causing widespread pain and fatigue.
recommendation: Medication, physical therapy, and stress management.

information: Softening and weakening of bones in children, usually due to vitamin D deficiency.
symptoms: Delayed growth, pain in spine, pelvis, and legs

information: Softening of the bones, often due to severe vitamin D deficiency.
Hormonal disorder that develops when the pituitary gland produces too much growth hormone.
symptoms: Enlarged hands and feet, facial changes, joint pain

information: Condition caused by prolonged exposure to high levels of cortisol.
recommendation: Reducing corticosteroid use, surgery, or medication.
symptoms: Weight gain, thinning skin, high blood pressure

information: Adrenal glands produce too little cortisol and aldosterone.
Autoimmune disorder leading to overactive thyroid (hyperthyroidism).
recommendation: Antithyroid medications, radioactive iodine, or surgery.

information: Autoimmune disorder causing an underactive thyroid (hypothyroidism).
Autoimmune condition where the body can't absorb enough vitamin B12.
Lack of sufficient vitamin B12 affecting red blood cell production.
symptoms: Fatigue, weakness, tingling in hands and feet

information: Group of blood disorders characterized by the body's inability to properly incorporate iron into hemoglobin.
recommendation: Vitamin B6 supplements and managing underlying causes.

information: Inherited blood disorder causing the body to make abnormal hemoglobin.
recommendation: Regular blood transfusions and chelation therapy.
symptoms: Fatigue, weakness, pale or yellowish skin

information: Genetic disorder impairing the blood's ability to clot.
recommendation: Regular replacement of the specific clotting factor.
symptoms: Excessive bleeding, easy bruising, joint pain

information: Inherited bleeding disorder caused by deficiency of von Willebrand factor.
Cancer of plasma cells in the bone marrow.
recommendation: Chemotherapy, stem cell transplant, and medications.

information: Cancer of blood-forming tissues, hindering the body's ability to fight infection.
recommendation: Chemotherapy, radiation therapy, and stem cell transplant.

information: A type of cancer that begins in the lymphatic system.
symptoms: Swollen lymph nodes, fever, night sweats

information: A group of blood cancers that includes all types of lymphoma except Hodgkin's lymphomas.
symptoms: Swollen lymph nodes, fever, weight loss

information: A type of lymphoma characterized by the presence of Reed-Sternberg cells.
symptoms: Swollen lymph nodes, fatigue, night sweats

information: A group of cancers that begin in the bones and in the soft tissues.
symptoms: Swelling, pain, or tenderness in the affected area

information: The most serious type of skin cancer, developing from melanocytes.
symptoms: Change in existing moles, new pigmented growths

information: The most common type of skin cancer, arising from basal cells.
symptoms: Pearly or waxy bump, flat, flesh-colored lesion

information: A common form of skin cancer that develops in the squamous cells.
symptoms: Firm red nodule, flat sore with a scaly crust

information: A slow-growing type of neuroendocrine tumor.
A cancer that arises from immature nerve cells, most commonly in children.
symptoms: Abdominal pain, lumps in the abdomen, bone pain

information: A rare kidney cancer that primarily affects children.
